common.remarks_smart_switch:
Tento profil poskytuje pouze hodnoty napájení v pohotovostním režimu. 
 Pokud máte spotřebič, který zapnutí spotřebovává pevně dané množství energie, můžete zadat tuto hodnotu v dalším kroku v nastavení
common.remarks_smart_dimmer:
Tento profil poskytuje pouze hodnoty spotřeby energie v pohotovostním režimu. 
 V dalším kroku můžete volitelně zadat hodnoty připojeného světla

abort.already_configured: Senzor je již nastaven, zadejte unikátní ID

error.daily_energy_mandatory: You must supply at least one of Value or Value template
error.entity_mandatory: Selecting an entity is required for any strategy other than playbook
error.fixed_mandatory: You must supply at least one of Power, Power template or States power
error.fixed_states_power_only: This entity can only work with 'states_power' not 'power'
error.group_mandatory: You must define at least subgroups or power and energy-entities
error.linear_mandatory: You must supply at least one of max_power or calibrate
error.linear_min_higher_as_max: Maximální spotřeba nebůže být nižší, nežli minimální spotřeba
error.linear_unsupported_domain: Entity domain not supported for linear mode. Must be one of: fan, light or mediaplayer. You can use the calibrate option however
error.lut_unsupported_color_mode: The LUT profile does not support one of the color modes of your light. See the logs for more info
error.lut_wrong_domain: Only light entities can use the LUT mode
error.playbook_mandatory: You need to specify at least one playbook
error.unknown: Unknown error occured, please see the logs for additional information

data_description.new_group: Pro vytvoření nové skupiny zadejte název skupiny

data_description.availability_entity: When this entity is unavailable, the powercalc sensor will be unavailable as well

availability_entity.title: Availability entity
availability_entity.description: This profile is per device. Please select the entity which will be used to determine the availability of the powercalc sensor

data_description.on_time: Pokud ponecháte prázdné, výchozí hodnota je 1 den. Vždy zapnuto
data_description.update_frequency: čas v sekundách mezi aktualizacemi stavu senzoru

group_domain.title: Create a domain based group sensor

data_description.power: Pevná hodnota příkonu ve wattech, když je entita zapnutá
data_description.power_template: Šablona bude vyhodnocena pro získání hodnoty příkonu ve wattech
data_description.states_power: One 'state: power' pair on each row, see example above

fixed.description:
Definujte fixní hodnotu příkonu pro vaši entitu. Případně můžete definovat hodnotu příkonu pro jednotlivé stavy. Například:

`playing: 8.3`
`paused: 2.25`
fixed.title: Fixed config

global_configuration.title: Globální konfigurace
global_configuration.description: Setup global configuration for Powercalc. For more information see the [documentation](https://docs.powercalc.nl/configuration/global-configuration/). Additional options for energy sensors and utility meters can be provided in the next steps.

data_description.create_energy_sensors: Whether powercalc needs to create kWh sensors
data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.
data_description.disable_extended_attributes: Disable all extra attributes powercalc adds to the power, energy and group entity states. This will help keep the database size small
data_description.disable_library_download: Disable the Powercalc library download feature
data_description.discovery_exclude_device_types: Exclude device types from the discovery process
data_description.force_update_frequency: Interval at which the sensor state is updated, even when the power value stays the same. In seconds
data_description.ignore_unavailable_state: Keep Powercalc sensors available, even when the source entity is unavailable
data_description.include_non_powercalc_sensors: Control whether you want to include non powercalc sensors in groups

data_description.area: Přidá všechny energetické senzory z určené oblasti
data_description.create_energy_sensor: Whether powercalc needs to create a kWh sensor
data_description.device: Add the group entities powercalc creates to an existing device
data_description.force_calculate_group_energy: By default powercalc sums the energy sensors from the member sensors. Toggle this option to force creating a Riemann Sum sensor
data_description.group_energy_entities: Další senzory energie (kWh) z vaší instalace HA k přidání
data_description.group_energy_start_at_zero: When enabled, the energy sensor will start at zero when the sensor is created. Otherwise it will sum all the current member energy sensor states
data_description.group_member_devices: Add power and energy entities from the selected devices to the group
data_description.group_member_sensors: Powercalc sensors to include in the group
data_description.group_power_entities: Další senzory energie (W) z vaší instalace HA k přidání
data_description.include_non_powercalc_sensors: Control whether to include non powercalc sensors when using the area option
data_description.sub_groups: All containing sensors from the selected subgroups will be added to this group as well

data_description.entity_id: Základní entita, od které se bude odečítat výkon
data_description.subtract_entities: Vyberte všechny entity které chcete odečíst od základní entity

data_description.main_power_sensor: Select the power sensor containing your total power usage. When left empty, only an tracked power sensor will be created
data_description.group_tracked_auto: Powercalc will automatically add all power sensors to the tracked group, skipping powercalc groups. Disable this when you'd like to manually define the tracked entities
data_description.create_energy_sensor: Whether powercalc needs to create a kWh sensor
data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.

group_tracked_untracked.description: Create a group sensor for all tracked and untracked power
group_tracked_untracked.title: Create a tracked power sensor

group_tracked_untracked_manual.description: Select all the power sensors which are part of the tracked consumption. It is already automatically populated, but you can manually adjust it
group_tracked_untracked_manual.title: Select power entities

group_tracked_untracked_auto.description: Exclude specific entities from the auto tracked group
group_tracked_untracked_auto.title: Auto tracked configuration

data_description.confirm_autodisovered_model: Pokud se rozhodnete nepotvrzovat, pak můžete zadat výrobce a model manuálně

library.description:
{source}

Výrobce "{manufacturer}" a model "{model}" byl automaticky detekován pro vaše zařízení.{remarks}
library.title: Knihovna

library_multi_profile.description: Manufacturer "{manufacturer}" and model "{model}" were automatically detected for your device. There are multiple profiles found for the entity which can potentially be used. Please look up the exact model of your device in [Powercalc library]({library_link}) and select the correct one
library_multi_profile.title: Knihovna

data_description.attribute: Specify the attribute. When left empty will be brightness for lights and percentage for fans
data_description.calibrate:
Put a calibration value on each line. Example

1: 20

model.description: Vyberte model zařízení. Viz [list]({supported_models_link}) podporovaných modelů pro více informací
model.title: Nastavení modelu

menu_group.title: Choose the group type
menu_group.description: Select the type of group sensor you want to create. Choose domain based group if you want to group all entities of a specific domain, or create a sensor summing all your energy sensors. Choose standard group otherwise.

data_description.entities: Select all the individual switches that are part of the multi switch
data_description.power: Power for a single switch when turned on
data_description.power_off: Power for a single switch when turned off

data_description.autostart: Indicate to start a certain playbook when HA starts. i.e. 'program1'
data_description.playbooks:
Enter a playbook on each line. Example

program1: washing_machine/program1.csv
data_description.repeat: Toggle when you want to keep repeating the playbook after it completes
data_description.states_trigger:
Trigger a playbook based on a state change. Example

playing: program1

data_description.calculation_enabled_condition: Konfigurovaná strategie výpočtu spotřeby bude aplikováná, pouze pokud se tato šablona vyhodnotí jako true nebo 1. Jinak bude senzor zobrazovat 0
data_description.ignore_unavailable_state: Přepněte toto nastavení, pokud chcete, aby byl senzor energie k dispozici i v případě, že zdrojová entita není dostupná
data_description.multiply_factor: Multiplies the calculated power by this ratio. Can be useful for light groups
data_description.multiply_factor_standby: Použít multiplikační faktor na pohotovostní režim
data_description.unavailable_power: Power in W to record when the source entity has an unavailable state
data_description.utility_meter_tariffs: A list of supported tariffs, leave empty if only a single tariff is needed.

power_advanced.description: Níže uvedené možnosti jsou pro pokročilou konfiguraci powercalc. Většina uživatelů je nebude používat, takže je můžete přeskočit
power_advanced.title: Pokročilá nastavení

data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.
data_description.name: Base name for the energy and utility meter. Full entity name will be set accordingly to energy_sensor_naming setting
data_description.device: Add the created energy sensor to an specific device

real_power.description: Currently specific settings can only be configured globally
real_power.title: Create an energy sensor for an existing power sensor

sub_profile.description:
This model has multiple sub profiles. Select one that suites your device

"{entity_id}"{remarks}
sub_profile.title: Sub profile config

data_description.power: A fixed power value in Watts for the connected appliance
data_description.self_usage_included: Whether the power value includes the power consumed by the smart switch itself. When you omit it Powercalc will add the self usage of the smart switch to the power value, which is {self_usage_power}W

smart_switch.description: Define the power consumption of the connected appliance. When it doesn't use a fixed amount of power you can skip this step. Powercalc will setup a power sensor for the self usage of the smart switch itself
smart_switch.title: Smart switch config

utility_meter_options.title: Utility meter options
utility_meter_options.description: Define the settings for utility meter creation here

data_description.utility_meter_net_consumption: Enable this if you would like to treat the source as a net meter. This will allow your counter to go both positive and negative.
data_description.utility_meter_types: Create utility meters for specified cycles
data_description.utility_meter_tariffs: A list of supported tariffs, leave empty if only a single tariff is needed.

data_description.create_energy_sensor: Whether powercalc needs to create a kWh sensor
data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.
data_description.entity_id: entity the virtual power is based on, the power sensor will listen to state changes of this entity to be updated
data_description.name: Leaving blank will take the name from the source entity
data_description.standby_power: Define the amount of power the device is consuming when in an OFF state

virtual_power.description: See the readme for more information about the possible strategies and configuration options
virtual_power.title: Create a virtual power sensor

wled.description: Make sure to enable brightness limiter in WLED software. Also see https://docs.powercalc.nl/strategies/wled/
wled.title: Konfigurace WLED

deprecated_platform_yaml.description: Configuring sensors using `sensor->platform` has been deprecated. You need to change your configuration to `powercalc->sensors`. Click on 'Learn more' for further instructions.
deprecated_platform_yaml.title: Nastavení Powercalc YAML bylo přesunuto

sub_profile.description:
This device has a model with multiple sub profiles. Select one that corresponds to the following entity of this device:

"{entity_id}"{remarks}
sub_profile.title: Select correct sub profile

data_description.calculation_enabled_condition: The configured power calculation strategy will only be executed when this template evaluates to true or 1, otherwise the power sensor will display 0
data_description.ignore_unavailable_state: Toggle this setting when you want the power sensor to stay available even if the source entity is unavailable
data_description.multiply_factor: Multiplies the calculated power by this ratio. Can be useful for light groups
data_description.multiply_factor_standby: Whether to also apply multiplication factor to standby power
data_description.unavailable_power: Power in W to record when the source entity has an unavailable state

data_description.create_energy_sensor: Whether powercalc needs to create a kWh sensor
data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.
data_description.entity_id: entity the virtual power is based on, the power sensor will listen to state changes of this entity to be updated
data_description.name: Leaving blank will take the name from the source entity
data_description.standby_power: Define the amount of power the device is consuming when in an OFF state

data_description.on_time: When left empty defaults to 1 day. always on
data_description.update_frequency: time in seconds between state updates of the sensor

data_description.power: A fixed power value in Watts when the entity is ON
data_description.power_template: Template will be evaluated to get the power value in W
data_description.self_usage_included: Whether the power value includes the power consumed by the smart switch itself.
data_description.states_power: One 'state: power' pair on each row, see example above

data_description.create_energy_sensors: Whether powercalc needs to create kWh sensors
data_description.create_utility_meters: Let powercalc create utility meters, which cycle daily, hourly etc.
data_description.disable_extended_attributes: Disable all extra attributes powercalc adds to the power, energy and group entity states. This will help keep the database size small
data_description.disable_library_download: Disable the Powercalc library download feature
data_description.discovery_exclude_device_types: Exclude device types from the discovery process
data_description.force_update_frequency: Interval at which the sensor state is updated, even when the power value stays the same. In seconds
data_description.ignore_unavailable_state: Keep Powercalc sensors available, even when the source entity is unavailable
data_description.include_non_powercalc_sensors: Control whether you want to include non powercalc sensors in groups
